image.altText: A young man wearing a baseball cap looks down at his phone

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering 15-year-old Cassius Turvey, Jack Brearley, will be applying for a separate trial on charges of detaining and assaulting another teenager in the days before the alleged attack on the Perth schoolboy.

title.children: One of Cassius Turvey's accused murderers wants separate trial for second alleged attack

image.altText: Current treasurer Jim Chalmers (left) and former treasurer Paul Keating (right).

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers is the same age as Paul Keating was when he declared Australia was in "the recession we had to have". Is he doomed to tread the same path?

title.children: Australia's economy is beginning to look a lot like 1990. But there's one key difference

image.altText: Greens leader Adam Bandt holds his arms out wide while speaking with Anthony Albanese in the House of Representatives

props.synopsis: It might have felt good to land a few punches on the Greens, but in winning that parliamentary battle some in Labor fear they could lose the war in key seats at the next election.

title.children: In teaming up with the Liberals against the Greens, Labor may have won the battle but lost the war

image.altText: A close shot of Brereton, who is sitting in the offices of the new national anti--corruption commission

props.synopsis: The National Anti-Corruption Commission (NACC) has announced it will not pursue fresh corruption investigations into six public officials involved in the robodebt scandal.

title.children: Anti-corruption watchdog decides not to pursue Robodebt corruption investigation

image.altText: A Chevron off-shore gas platform

props.synopsis: A plan by oil and gas giant Chevron to leave five decommissioned oil platforms off Western Australia's Pilbara coast draws the ire of unions and green groups.

title.children: Abandoned oil platforms to be left off WA coast by energy giant Chevron

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Greg Lynn has taken the stand before a Supreme Court jury as he fights two murder charges over the deaths of missing campers Carol Clay and Russell Hill.

title.children: Greg Lynn apologises to families of Victorian campers as he gives evidence in murder trial

image.altText: A helicopter unloads SES volunteers onto a clifftop near Lake Argyle.

props.synopsis: State Emergency Services are responding to a rescue in WA's far north, near Lake Argyle near Kununurra.

title.children: Remote rescue underway in far northern Western Australia

image.altText: Farmers standing in shed.

props.synopsis: Wheatbelt farmers like Kristin Lefroy are sitting on a secure water supply despite having endured a bone-dry summer and autumn. They say adopting desalination has been the key.

title.children: Five years ago these farmers' salty wells were useless. Now they are a source of pure water when it is needed most

image.altText: Lightning appears amid a storm as Mount Ibu spews volcanic material during an eruption, as seen from Gam Ici in West Halmahera,

props.synopsis: Indonesia's Mount Ibu volcano erupts twice in the same day, firing bright red lava and rocks into the night sky, triggering a spectacular display of volcanic lightning.

title.children: Indonesia's Mount Ibu volcano erupts twice in one day, spewing red-hot lava and triggering lightning

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: Industry experts say it's not time to ring the alarm bells over low building approval numbers, but the federal government's plan for 1.2 million homes by 2029 is definitely ambitious.

title.children: Property experts say planning approvals in Australia are 'stuck in the 1980s'

image.altText: A crowd of people holding signs.

props.synopsis: Police say they will deploy about 1,600 officers as thousands of workers who are against moves to bring in a mandatory deduction from their pay gather in Jakarta to protest against one of the last policies to be enacted by outgoing president Joko Widodo.

title.children: 'You can't even afford a Barbie house': Why Indonesians are angry about a new national housing scheme

image.altText: Women in a rally against domestic violence.

props.synopsis: A string of violent attacks has left nine WA women dead this year, three of them killed in the past fortnight. What is behind WA's alarmingly high rate of gendered violence?

title.children: Nine WA women have been killed in violent acts this year — a rate double that of NSW

image.altText: Police tape in front of an area of park at the base of cliffs. A blue tent can be seen, and a police officer with a tripod.

props.synopsis: Constance Watcho was last seen walking down a Kangaroo Point street with her partner in November 2017.

title.children: A mother-of-10's remains were found dumped at a popular walking spot but how she died 'may never be known'

image.altText: Close up of Putin in a suit

props.synopsis: Russia could arm countries with long-range weapons to strike Western targets in response to NATO allies allowing Ukraine to use their arms to attack Russian territory, President Vladimir Putin warns.

title.children: Putin warns Russia could provide weapons to strike Western targets

image.altText: A young blonde woman with a fringe smiles in front of a wall.

props.synopsis: Australian trade unions have endorsed a campaign to end the junior wages scheme, which legally allows hospitality and retail employees under 21 to be paid less than their adult colleagues.

title.children: 'Legal discrimination against young people': Unions to push for scrapping of junior wages

image.altText: Two men in suits walk across a road.

props.synopsis: Canberra builder Brendan Howe, 35, pleaded guilty to four charges including the aggravated assault when his ex-wife was 34 weeks pregnant. Howe sent a letter of apology to the court, but Justice Louise Taylor said it showed no genuine remorse.

title.children: 'I am the boss': Canberra builder avoids jail for repeated assault of ex-wife, including while heavily pregnant

image.altText: Protesters sit down and chant at the Australian National University pro-Palestine encampment.

props.synopsis: The ABC confirms a student has been expelled after making comments about Hamas on ABC radio in April.

title.children: ANU expels pro-Palestinian student after comments made on air stating Hamas deserves 'unconditional support'

image.altText: A semi-circle of large rocks with a waterfall in the middle of it.

props.synopsis: Park officials had to come clean about the inflow pipe, after a video was shared on the social media site Douyin.

title.children: Yuntai Falls, China's highest waterfall, is boosted by an inflow pipe at the top, officials admit

image.altText: Isabel Walker Life Chances 2

props.synopsis: A long-term study of the lives of 167 babies can tell us a lot about how family bonds, wealth, education and changes to our social safety net can impact a person's life.

title.children: Destiny's children: The 167 babies researchers say show us the importance of family above finances

image.altText: Officer Cadets on parade at ADFA.

props.synopsis: A workplace survey has revealed more than a third of female recruits reported sexual misconduct while attending the Australian Defence Force Academy in Canberra.

title.children: More than a third of female defence academy recruits report sexual misconduct  — as it happened

image.altText: A medium shot of a man in a suit and tie standing and speaking into a microphone at a lecturn. He holds up one clenched hand

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt has threatened Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus with legal action over remarks he made that Mr Bandt says were defamatory.

title.children: Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus threatened with legal action by Greens leader after Gaza protest comments

image.altText: A large crowd of people, including many waving Israeli flags, outside a large building.

props.synopsis: Violence has erupted at Israel's annual Jerusalem Day march, with some Jewish Israelis attacking Palestinians and journalists, including an ABC News team, while chanting offensive slogans.

title.children: Palestinians, journalists attacked as crowds chant 'Death to Arabs' at Israel's annual Jerusalem Day march

image.altText: Two men and two women, three in formal wear and one in high-vis, shovel dirt outside a large building.

props.synopsis: The WA Auditor-General found the upgrade works to be the state's most delayed project, but Premier Roger Cook has finally turned the sod after years of frustration.

title.children: After years of delays and cost blowouts, work finally underway on Geraldton hospital upgrade

image.altText: A photo of Daryl, Jacki, John and Ossie all smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Reflecting on how TV has evolved since the demise of the variety genre on Australian screens — and that's not necessarily a bad thing.

title.children: The daggy humour of Hey Hey made cruel jokes permissible in the mainstream. Thankfully TV has evolved

image.altText: A man leaning against hemp bales.

props.synopsis: While pushed as a sustainable source for clothing, hemp producers say a complex web of rules and regulations — including going through the office of drug control — make it hard for them to meet demands from the fashion industry.

title.children: Hemp producers say bureaucracy, marijuana stigma, are major hurdles to fibre crop's uptake

image.altText: red, white and blue jet on the tarmac in Broome

props.synopsis: WA Police are calling for information after a green "high-powered" laser light was pointed at a Royal Flying Doctor Service plane landing in Broome.

title.children: 'Incredibly dangerous': Police investigating laser targeting of RFDS aircraft

image.altText: A wide shot of a rusting colonial cottage with weeds growing over it on the right hand side.

props.synopsis: When Kirsty and Mark decided to rescue and restore this 170-year-old cottage, they knew there'd be some unexpected challenges. But first they had to reclaim it from the blackberries and weeds "holding it together".

title.children: Saved from blackberries and ruin: See how one couple restored this 170-year-old cottage

image.altText: A girl and a woman cross a road together, the girl wearing a black jumper over her head to hide her identify.,

props.synopsis: The Maroochydore District Court heard the teenager was one of three girls who lured the victim to a house before inflicting four hours of abuse.

title.children: 'Her parents have failed her': Teenager sentenced over torture of 13yo at Noosa

image.altText: Australia batter Marcus Stoinis follows through with a shot, with the ball airborne, heading for six runs

props.synopsis: Marcus Stoinis top scored with 67 from 36 balls before taking three wickets as Australia defeated Oman by 39 runs in Barbados.

title.children: Stoinis leads the way with bat and ball as Australia begin World Cup with win

image.altText: A composite image showing a shark and an echidna, both swimming in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Nicholas Lubitz witnessed the remarkable emetic incident during a three-year project that saw hundreds of marine creatures tagged off the Queensland coast.

title.children: 'Wasn't quite sitting right': Scientist shocked by sight of shark vomiting up echidna

image.altText: Michael, Roy and Gia all sit outside in a park, arm in arm.

props.synopsis: Wollongong actor and reality television star Michael Theo has landed his first major production, playing a character inspired by him in a new comedy drama called Austin.

title.children: 'I also don't have a filter': Love on the Spectrum star lands lead role in new comedy show

image.altText: Clothing hangs on a dryer rack indoors with a small fan nearby

props.synopsis: We speak to science communicator Lish Fejer, one half of FixIt Chicks, for her top tips and "unconventional ways" of drying laundry this winter — without the cost of a dryer.

title.children: How to dry laundry faster without the cost of a dryer

image.altText: A white and black dog trying to poke its head out of a cat flap

props.synopsis: A cat stuck in a hole, a dog who looks like his owner, and a Tarzan flying cat are among the winners of the 2024 Comedy Pet Photo Awards.

title.children: Hector the dog trying to squeeze through a tiny cat flap wins funniest pet photo of the year
